original: LINDBLAD, Axel Rudolf, Fil Dr, Djursholm, f Vånga, Ögl, 23/4 74 av lantbr Ad L o Margareta Andersson, gm 1) Ester Bergman (d 30), 2) Sigrid Fridén f Pehrsson. Ex Norrkps tekn elem.sk. Anst olika firmor 01— 06, en av led f de av bl a Jernkont understödda grundlägg exper betr elektr tackj- o stål-framställn; uppf fi metoder f elektr fram-ställn av metaller o met.legrar; init.tag t malmletn.arb i Västerb 18 (varund bl a Bolidens gruvfält upptäcktes); förbättr o uppf" malmletn.metoder, bl a en f malmletn spec lämpad gravimeter; ss tekn led f Rönnskärs smältverk uppf fi metoder f Boliden-malmen»Ibearb, metoder f svavelframst ur smältverks -gaserna eller direkt ur svavelkis mm. Fd stdsflm o Idstm, led krigsmtrlkomm 17—23, socialiser.nmdn 20—25, rikskommiss f ekon försv.beredsk 29—38, v. ordf Sv kem ind.kont 32—42, ordf Försv.väs:s kem anstis vetensk råd 37—41. Fil hed.dr Upps 17. KNOlkl, KVOlkl, Iqml 12 :e storl, LVA, LVA i Oslo,
translated: LINDBLAD, Axel Rudolf, PhD, Djursholm, b. Vånga, Ögl, April 23, 1874, to Ad L. and Margareta Andersson, married 1) Ester Bergman (deceased 1930), 2) Sigrid Fridén, neé Pehrsson. Former student at Norrkp's technical elementary school. Employed by various companies from 1901 to 1906, holding a leading position in several foundations subsidized by Jernkont in the field of electrical welding and steel production; developed methods for the electric production of metals and metal alloys; initiated ore prospecting work in Västerbotten in 1918 (where, among other things, Boliden's mining field was discovered); improved and developed ore prospecting methods, including a gravimeter suitable for ore prospecting; served as technical director at Rönnskärs smelter, where he developed methods for processing Boliden ore, extracting sulfur from smelter gases, and directly from pyrite, and more. Former member of the city council and the county council, member of the military material committee from 1917 to 1923, member of the nationalization committee from 1920 to 1925, commissioner of economic defense preparedness from 1929 to 1938, deputy chairman of the Swedish Chemical Industry Control Board from 1932 to 1942, chairman of the Defense Technical Research Council from 1937 to 1941. Honorary Doctor of Philosophy from Uppsala University in 1917. Knight of the Order of the North Star, Knight of the Order of Vasa, 12th class of the Swedish Academy, Member of the Royal Swedish Academy of Sciences, and the Norwegian Academy of Sciences.

activities.name: Ore Prospect
activities.description: Initiated ore prospecting work in Västerbotten in 1918, contributing to the discovery of Boliden's mining field.

activities.name: Ore Prospecting Methods
activities.description: Improved and developed ore prospecting methods, including the design of a gravimeter suitable for ore prospecting.

activities.name: Electrical Welding and Steel Production
activities.description: Developed methods for electric production of metals and metal alloys in foundations subsidized by Jernkont.

activities.name: Sulfur Extraction
activities.description: Developed methods for extracting sulfur from smelter gases and directly from pyrite.

honors.name: Knight of the Order of the North Star
Knight of the Order of Vasa
